intro: Meniscium pubescens, commonly known as the hairy meniscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Meniscium pubescens is typically found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
